alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:44PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 515 PM MDT... At 444 PM MDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Kit Carson, or 15 miles west of Cheyenne Wells, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Firstview. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 146 and 147. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
